issues.description: The template’s singFarmSongVerse method signature omits the Animal parameter specified in the UML and problem description. Without an Animal parameter, students cannot implement the verse logic (e.g., animal.getClass().getSimpleName(), animal.messageOnFeed()) as intended.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template signature to match the UML: change to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal).

issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to an interface named Rideable, but the solution repository defines this interface as Mountable. This name mismatch will confuse students when they implement or reference the Rideable interface.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the Mountable interface in the solution to Rideable (and update Pig and Seal to implement Rideable) so names align with the specification.

issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to an interface named Rideable, but the solution repository defines and uses an interface named Mountable for the same concept. This prevents students from mapping the Rideable requirement to the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solution interface Mountable (and its file) to Rideable, and update all references (Pig, Seal, Farm, Main) to use Rideable so names align across problem, template, and solution.
